page.title: 09The College
page.content: St. Edmund's College was founded in 1793 after the refugees from the English College at Douai (founded in 1568) were expelled from France and joined the school at Old Hall Green (founded in 1769).The main college buildings were constructed in 1798/9. The College remained both a school and seminary until 1915 when the latter moved to Chelsea. The College has 520 boys and girls from eight to eighteen years of age.It comprises of St.Hugh's (boys 8-13), Junior House (boys and girls 11-13), five senior boy's houses and one senior girl's House.All houses are mixed - both day and boarding students.A broad curriculum of academic and creative arts subjects is followed through to 'O' level,with a high percentage following on to 'A' level and higher education prospects.
